forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 44. Northeast wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Thanksgiving Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. North northeast wind around 9 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the night sky drapes itself in a serene veil of clarity, unmarred by fog, casting a tranquil aura over the city as the clock nears midnight. Tonight, temperatures gently settle around 44 degrees, accompanied by a soft northeast breeze whispering through the streets. This evening offers a comforting chill, inviting those who venture out to wrap themselves in their warmest layers—a cozy knit or perhaps a dependable jacket to guard against the night air’s kiss.

As dawn approaches Thanksgiving Day, the promise of sunshine hovers on the horizon, poised to awaken the city with a warm embrace. Daytime temperatures will reach a fair 58 degrees and gradually recede to around 53 by the afternoon, making it a splendid backdrop for leisurely strolls or serene moments in cafes dotted throughout the bustling neighborhoods. The cool winds from the north-northeast will continue to weave through the day, ensuring the air remains crisp yet invigorating. With the absence of fog, the Golden Gate Bridge stands proud, an invitation to explore and revel in the charm of San Francisco’s iconic vistas. It’s a day to savor outdoor walks or perhaps a quiet afternoon in a cozy bookshop, allowing time to drift by in gentle contentment, as the heart of the city pulses with life and gratitude.
